alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 7:30PM CDT until September 10 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Campbell, Claiborne and Union. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 828 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms during the past hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area in the next hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... La Follette, New Tazewell, Tazewell, Harrogate, Jellico, Clairfield, Springdale, White Oak, Sandlick, Arthur, Fincastle, Cumberland Gap and Powell River Preserve. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
